sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Views are logical containers which can help you in organizing the jobs within Jenkins. As a Jenkins instance expands, it is logical to create associated views for appropriate groups and categories. For example it may be a good idea to create a Build view, which displays build-specific jobs within it. This action creates a view on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • View Name - Name of the view to be created on Jenkins. E.g. Releases.
  • View Type - The type of view to be created. Select either of 'List View' or 'My View' from the drop down list.
    • List View - Shows items in a simple list format.
    • My View - This view automatically displays all the jobs that the user has an access to.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of your parent folder under which you want to create your new view. E.g. snow/development.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Parent folder path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • The request could not be fulfilled due to invalid characters in view name.
  • A view already exists with the name.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.

Additional Notes:

  • If Parent Folder Path is not specified then the new view will be created on the top level of Jenkins.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Create View

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
Views are logical containers which can help you in organizing the jobs within Jenkins. As a Jenkins instance expands, it is logical to create associated views for appropriate groups and categories. For example it may be a good idea to create a Build view, which displays build-specific jobs within it. This action creates a view on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • View Name - Name of the view to be created on Jenkins. E.g. Releases.
  • View Type - The type of view to be created. Select either of 'List View' or 'My View' from the drop down list.
    • List View - Shows items in a simple list format.
    • My View - This view automatically displays all the jobs that the user has an access to.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of your parent folder under which you want to create your new view. E.g. snow/development.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Parent folder path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • The request could not be fulfilled due to invalid characters in view name.
  • A view already exists with the name.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.

Additional Notes:

  • If Parent Folder Path is not specified then the new view will be created on the top level of Jenkins.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
